      • convertStringToInteger

        public static java.lang.Integer convertStringToInteger(java.lang.String value)
                                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method convert String to Integer if value is null then IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        value - to convert to Integer
        Returns:
        integer value of String value given in parameter
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if value is null or conversion is unsuccessful

      • readInputSteam

        public static java.lang.StringBuilder readInputSteam(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        This method read all from input stream and return StringBuilder which holds all line form input stream
        Parameters:
        inputStream - input stream which holds data to read
        Returns:
        StringBuilder which contains all data from input stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if during creation phase or read is thrown error

      • buildDocumentFromFile

        public static org.w3c.dom.Document buildDocumentFromFile(java.io.InputStream is)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method create Document from input file. This document can be parsed by DOM or SAX.
        Parameters:
        file - from which will be created document to parse
        Returns:
        Document which will be parsed by DOM or SAX
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If exception occurs during open file or parsing file then IllegalArgumentException is thrown, because input file given in parameter is illegal

      • evaluateElExpression

        public static java.lang.String evaluateElExpression(java.lang.String expressionToEvaluate,
                                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        This method parse input string and replaced all #{value} values in hash and bracket by value given in parameters. If value is not found then null is inserted.
      • inputs : expressionToEvaluate/home/#{user}, parameters: user:martin; result /home/martin
      • inputs : expressionToEvaluate/home/#{user}/#{subdir}, parameters: user:martin, subdir:backup; result /home/martin/backup
      • inputs : expressionToEvaluate/home/#{user}/#{subDir}, parameters: user:martin, subdir:backup; result /home/martin/null
          • Please note that this parser can't handle with unpairs {} in input parameters
Parameters:
expressionToEvaluate - this is expression which will be processed and in which will all value in #{} replaced by value from has map given in second parameter
parameters - which holds value which will be inserted to input string called expressionToEvaluate
Returns:
string which has replaced all #{} values from hash map given as parameter. If value is not found in hash map then null is inserted
